definition: extend one's limbs or muscles, or the entire body
details:
verb
- extend one's limbs or muscles, or the entire body
= synonyms: stretch
- thrust or extend out
= synonyms: exsert, stretch out, hold out, stretch forth, put out
- increase in quantity or bulk by adding a cheaper substance
= synonyms: stretch
- continue or extend
= synonyms: carry
- lengthen in time
= synonyms: prolong, protract, draw out
- prolong the time allowed for payment of
= example: prolong the time allowed for payment of
- extend in scope or range or area
= example: extend in scope or range or area
= synonyms: widen
- expand the influence of
= example: expand the influence of
= synonyms: expand
- use to the utmost
= synonyms: strain
- open or straighten out
- cause to move at full gallop
= synonyms: gallop
- extend or stretch out to a greater or the full length
= synonyms: stretch
- offer verbally
= example: offer verbally
= synonyms: offer
- make available
= synonyms: offer
- stretch out over a distance, space, time, or scope
= example: stretch out over a distance, space, time, or scope
= synonyms: pass
- span an interval of distance, space or time
= example: span an interval of distance, space or time
= synonyms: cover
- reach outward in space
= example: reach outward in space
= synonyms: reach out, poke out
